narrative.title: Xiii Corps - 1942Q1
narrative.situation: British Infantry Corps deployed in North Africa during 1942Q1.
narrative.objectives: Infantry corps holding forward defensive positions along Gazala Line after January 1942 retreat. Responsible for southern sector of Eighth Army defenses. Mixed Commonwealth composition (British, South African, Indian, Free French, Polish units).
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain (Gazala Line) and inland rocky desert

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Multinational command coordination (5 nations under single corps HQ)
Desert defensive operations with extensive minefield networks
Mobile reserves with attached armored division

environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain (Gazala Line) and inland rocky desert
